name: The National Security Act
description: A debate in the Diet regarding the national security act has been raging for the past few weeks, and it is time for us to decide which course our nation will take. Some conservative members of the Diet fear that if the act isn't passed, radical elements in society will try to seize power. The future of Japan is in our hands.

name: Defend Democracy!
description: After receiving the offer from the scheming army officers, General Hayashi Senjuro has refused to back their coup attempt, citing his responsibility to the established regime. With the trial of the May 15th incident behind us, it is now time to secure democracy in the eyes of the people.

name: The Longest Day
description: General Hayashi Senjuro has agreed to support the scheming army officers in their coup attempt. With support from the army minister, it seems like their attempt will be successful...

name: Electoral Reform
description: After an extensive review of our voting system, several loopholes and oversights have been discovered. They allow significant amounts of voter fraud in general elections. By introducing a reform package to our electoral process, we can hopefully limit this phenomenon.

name: Enact Women's Suffrage
description: While feminist activity started in Japan back in the 19th century, they have only recently managed to achieve any progress by overthrowing the 'Police Security Act' in 1921. Recently, more liberal minded members of the Diet have been pushing to finally grant women full political rights as part of Japan's growing democratic traditions.

name: Academic Pluralism
description: Pluralism is a central part of any democracy. By encouraging pluralism in our academic institutions, we can improve our research and education!

name: Constitutional Education
description: By introducing a new curriculum to the public-school system that includes democratic theory and principles, we will raise a new generation of Japanese youth who will enshrine the ideas of humanism and democracy.

name: Cultural Golden Age
description: The openness and enlightenment of our society have brought a golden age in culture, both traditional and modern. Ancient arts of theatre and poetry are flourishing, as well as new forms of entertainment such as films and animation. This reflects greatly on us abroad and strengthens Japanese values both in foreign and domestic markets.

name: Military Centralism
description: The Emperor has refused to support the government, and now a coup is certain. The question is no longer if, but when and who...

name: A Political Blueprint
description: After our assumption of power we are expected to draw out a national political plan reflecting our militarist ideology. In the following weeks, the supreme military council will be meeting to discuss such a document.

name: National Total Mobilisation Ordinance
description: The National Total Mobilisation Ordinance is designed to provide the Government a means to control and mobilise all the resources and manpower available in the Empire. During wartime, we will have full control over the labour supply, production of goods, financial institutions, industrial and labour organisations, as well as prices and the press.

name: Military Training Curriculum
description: Military training was first introduced into the compulsory physical education curriculum in 1925 by the Tanaka regime as a way to subdue growing anti-militarist influence and discontent among students. It was discontinued with the Constitutional Restoration of 1926, but it is time to reverse that decision.

name: Fund Adjustment Ordinance
description: The Fund Adjustment Ordinance is the first of a series of 'National Defence Ordinances' decrees by the Centralist regime. The state-owned Bank of Japan is now empowered with the regulation of capital investments, the establishment of companies, and the subscription or underwriting of securities. This will allow the Government to control and allocate funds to war industries.

name: National Service Draft Ordinance
description: The National Service Draft Ordinance is new act which enables the Government to mobilise the labour force even in peace time, and additionally, it removes several barriers that delay such mobilisations. This new Ordinance will improve both our peace- and wartime output.

name: One Corporate State
description: The time has finally come to transform Japan into a unified and strong corporate state, where every individual does his part for the good of the Emperor and the Kokutai.

name: The Shōwa Restoration
description: After being left out of key governmental and administrative positions in the new Japanese government, the Restoration faction of the army is disgruntled, and is planning another coup. If they are to gain the support of the Emperor, they are likely to succeed.

name: Yokuseiha Faction
description: The Yokuseiha faction is comprised of ex-parliament members with restorationist tendencies. They resist the dictatorial plans set by Konoe for the Taisei Yokusankai and prefer a decentralised approach to restoration.

name: Separation of Powers
description: While supporting imperial restoration, the Yokuseiha members also see a problem with absolute power. Partly to prevent corruption, and partly to secure their power, they arrange a decentralised system for the Taisei Yokusankai.

name: A Free Market
description: Keeping in line with their decentralised approach, the Yokuseiha propose an economic plan consisting of minimal state intervention in the economy. While this would allow groups like the Zaibatsu to gain more power, this policy will also endear the regime to them.

name: Colonial Investments
description: In response to the agricultural crisis Japan faces, the Yokuseiha faction proposes a programme of settlement incentives in Japanese mainland colonies in China and elsewhere. By increasing agricultural input from abroad, the homeland economy could shift its focus to other sectors and supply logistics would be improved.

name: Kōdōha Faction
description: The Kōdōha faction is made up of restorationist army generals and officers who wish to bring Japan back to its folkish roots and create a strong imperial power at the head of the state.

name: Imperial Power
description: The Kōdōha faction resists Konoe's efforts in creating a separate dictatorial power from the imperial court and instead wish to transfer ultimate power to the emperor in a form of absolutism where the Taisei Yokusankai is a subject of the emperor.

name: Nationalisation
description: The Kōdōha faction's economic plan involves nationalisation of the economy for a dedicated empire-oriented production. By establishing an institution for government control such nationalisation can begin.

name: Intensify Land Use
description: The revolutionary part of the Kōdōha faction believe that we can make more out of the land we have. By adjusting agriculture and production techniques, and throwing away the traditional land designations, we will improve the density of our industry.

name: Kakushinha Faction
description: The Kakushinha, or reform faction, is led by Prince Konoe and is mainly comprised of intellectuals and politicians. They aim for a reconstruction of the Japanese political system with an absolute Taisei Yokusankai at the core of Japanese society.

name: A New System
description: The political plan of the Kakushinha faction was to create a single centralised political body which will combine the executive, legislative and administrative powers of the Japanese empire. Despite heavy resistance, the reformists' domination of the first convention allowed them to pull through with the reforms.

name: Bureaucratic Regulation
description: The Kakushinha faction's economic policy involves creating a bureaucratic system to regulate the economy as part of the Taisei Yokusankai.

name: Bureaucratic Agrarianism
description: The Kakushinha faction's solution to Japan's crumbling agricultural system is to create another bureaucratic institution to regulate land ownership in the empire.

name: National R&D Institutes
description: By funding National Research and Development Institutes, we can make it easier for independent research teams to work together, improving our research output, and allowing us to better direct national research priorities.

name: Rapid Arms Expansion
description: While our economy is growing, and we avoided much of the fallout of Black Monday, our arms productions still isn't what it has the potential to be. By building factories designed specifically for such purposes, we will be able to greatly expand our arms production.

name: Narrow-gauge Railways
description: Our narrow-gauge railways had their advantages during construction, but now they hold back our burgeoning industry. The future waits for no-one, least of all Japan.

name: Prioritise Military Oil
description: With the country at war, oil is more vital than ever. While it is useful for many civilian purposes, it is vital for our armed forces. As such, we must prioritise oil for military uses first and foremost.

name: Land Reform
description: Land use is highly inefficient in Japan. Nearly all the factions agree that something must be done, though what exactly prompts much disagreement. Nevertheless, if we are to realise our full economic might, we must solve this issue.

name: RIKEN North
description: RIKEN North is the codename for a soon-to-be-established key facility in our Ni-Go Project, located in the Fukushima prefecture.\nThe Ni-Go Project is our top-secret endeavour in atomic research, aiming at separating uranium-235 by thermal diffusion.\nThe other facilities taking part in this project are at the Tokyo RIKEN complex and in Kōnan, Northern Korea.

name: Rocket Science
description: Rocket developments can not only provide us with rocket weaponry, but even, the scientists theorise, with rocket engines for high speed travel.

name: Support the Zaibatsu
description: Over the past several decades the Zaibatsu have increased their political and economic power to a staggering degree. It would be in our best interest to cooperate with them.

name: Zaibatsu Factory Construction
description: Some Zaibatsu have requested for the state to aid them in building factories throughout the home islands. This would create many jobs and help resolve the economic crisis.

name: Zaibatsu Central Railroad
description: The Central Railroad Plan, a series of new and modernised train lines in the home islands, has been at the forefront of our continued push towards an efficient and productive society. However it has been delayed for years now, lacking both funding and expertise. Luckily however, the Zaibatsu are able to provide both and so, with their backing, the project can finally be completed.

name: Zaibatsu Resource Projects
description: Various Zaibatsu have approached us with raw resource prospects requesting us to fund them. Our funding should give access to much needed rare resources.

name: Zaibatsu Technological Research
description: State funds would go a long way to ensuring that skilled Zaibatsu scientists have everything they need to push Japan forward into the future and should give the government greater control over research priorities.

name: Nationalisation Policy
description: For too long, the Zaibatsu and foreign imperialists have deceived and exploited our people for their personal profit. Let us take control of the economy and nationalise the industry for the good of all of Japan!

name: Nationalise Heavy Industry
description: After the breakup and nationalisation of the Zaibatsu, we control most of the heavy industry in the country - but not all. Some companies are below Zaibatsu level in prominence but still major firms. To achieve total state control, it will be necessary to nationalise them.

name: Nationalise the Aircraft Industry
description: The aircraft industry is a vital part of national defence and is thus too important to be left in private hands. All military aircraft manufacturers must be nationalised and reformed into arsenals or merged into military controlled factories.

name: Nationalise The Zaibatsu
description: Since the Meiji Restoration and subsequent westernisation the Zaibatsu have been the heart of economic and industrial activity within Japan. They hold great influence over domestic and foreign policy. The Imperial Army has always opposed the Zaibatsu's influence and worked toward their liquidation. Now that they effectively control the country, the Army can nationalise all major Zaibatsu and destroy their influence.

name: Bureaucratic Economy
description: The government decided to reform the economy to be regulated by a bureaucratic structure. It is designed to limit the Zaibatsu's power and increase benefits for the state.

name: Regulating the Automotive Industry
description: Throughout the 1920s and 1930s, Japanese domestic automotive production was too small to compete globally. To remedy this and enable domestic firms to compete with much bigger Western counterparts, we can force a merger of our many small automotive firms into a few big businesses.

name: Integration of Foreign Motor Companies
description: The Japanese auto market has always been dominated by American car makers, causing a deep trade deficit. When the Second American Civil War broke out many American companies and knock-down plants in Japan lost contact with their parent companies, giving MITI bureaucrats a prime opportunity to assimilate those factories. Even when the Second American Civil War ends, it will be decades before they will be able to compete again.

name: Reorganise Resource Extraction
description: With tensions rising all over the world, it is vital for our resource extraction to happen effectively and quickly. To achieve this, firms involved in resource extraction will be subjected to greater bureaucratic supervision and forced to undergo a structural reorganisation under the government's guidance.

name: The Shinkansen Proposal
description: It is time to enact the Shinkansen proposal: create a connect set of high speed railways then combine them with new steam and electric locomotives. These lines would be able to carry passengers and freight at speeds never seen before.

name: Chosen Modernisation
description: It may be best not to outright own Chosen but rather rule it as a puppet nation. Through modernising their economy they will become a more useful ally and our economy would surely benefit.

name: Colonial Incentives
description: In order to save our dying agrarian sector and further expand our economy we sorely need to invest in colonial projects. The Empire is Japan's future.

name: Chosen Integration
description: The closest colony to the Home Islands, Chosen has long been the aim of economic and cultural assimilation efforts. These are not complete however, and with additional funding and expanded Japanese settlement it will be possible to fully integrate Chosen.

name: Taiwan Integration
description: Taiwan, the richest and most prosperous colony in the Empire, promises limitless bounty to those that settle there. Long our model colony, it is time to put the final funding in to fully integrate Taiwan into our Empire.

name: Kwantung Integration
description: Although the Kwantung Leased Territory was only officially granted to Japan for a period of 99 years, the city of Dairen and its surroundings make an excellent destination for Japanese settlers. The Government has every reason to provide further incentives, increasing emigration.

name: Hawaiian Integration
description: Japanese-Hawaiians make up a large portion of the population of that island chain, and as a result Japanese is already a common language in schools and homes. It should be a relatively smooth transition to ensure that the upper classes are Japanese too and thereby turn the place into proper prefectures.

name: Jakuniku Kyōshoku
description: Jakuniku Kyōshoku or 'Survival of the Fittest' is a fundamental understanding in our military philosophy; the Western imperialists have greatly expanded their air forces and navies and if we do not do the same we will surely fall victim to their forces.

name: Army Direction
description: After years of bickering, it is time to make a choice as to the Imperial Army's direction. Strategic planners from Imperial General Headquarters present four promising options.\n\n§YChoosing which army theorem we want to implement will greatly affect the content of our focus tree.§!

name: Results of Second Maru Keikaku
description: We can't just focus on our army, our navy needs reforming as well.

name: Air-Land Supremacy
description: Our army needs to be like a tsunami: it must crush our enemies with an unstoppable advance, and we will obtain this result by achieving cooperation between the army and the air force. If this reform will prove itself successful, we will be able to rain hell on our enemies.

name: Supremacy of Will
description: The Japanese people must seek to embody \"Yamato-Damashii\", the \"Spirit of Old Japan\", as wars are won by tenacity and the willingness of the Japanese soldier to die for the Emperor and Kokutai. In 1905 the Imperial Army lost nearly one hundred thousand soldiers to the Russians in Manchuria, and yet claimed victory nonetheless. Once again his Imperial Majesty calls upon Japan's noble sons to fight!

name: Numerical Supremacy
description: The Weltkrieg clearly showed us one thing: numbers win wars. Although our industrial capacity can’t match that of Germany, we can create cheaper equipment in order to match their numbers. Its quality might not be excellent, but in the end, having cheap equipment is better than having no equipment at all.

name: Supremacy of Mind
description: Traditionally our military has focused on winning wars through numbers or sheer determination; in reality Japan's greatest victories have come through being more advanced than her opponents. Nowadays however we cannot rely on buying western equipment first, so if we wish to retain our advantage over our enemies we mush embrace technological supremacy to win the wars of tomorrow.

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyMobilityTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyMobilityDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyTankTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyTankDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmySupportTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmySupportDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyOpsTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyOpsDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyLandTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyLandDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyAirTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyAirDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyInfTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyInfDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyBigTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyBigDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyPlanesTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyPlanesDescription]

name: [JapanGetFocusArmyBombersTitle]
description: [JapanGetFocusArmyBombersDescription]

name: Protecting the Home Islands
description: Right now, vast stretches of water controlled by our mighty navy are protecting our Home Islands. In these endless plains, each island represents a strategic target and we should make fortresses from each of them. Protecting our Pacific holdings will allow our unbeatable navy to operate on long distances.

name: Pacific Amphibious Operations
description: The Kaigun Tokubetsu Rikusentai, our marines, are some of the most well-trained, hardened and loyal troops in the world. German, Dutch, Chinese and anyone else who dares to stand in their way will without a doubt end up rotting on their beaches. But in the upcoming war, loyalty and training will be pointless without proper equipment.

name: Naval Bombers
description: Some of the staff of the IJNAS claim that the upcoming battles of the sea will not be won on the waves, but in the clouds. We should listen to them, as ships are much more expensive than planes after all.

name: Unsinkable Carriers
description: While carriers are mighty machines and weapons, they take long to build and just a moment to sink. The same can't be said about island airfields, which can operate even bigger planes than our carriers.

name: Start Third Maru Keikaku
description: As we can't fight a prolonged war with the enemy, our only option is to continue with current naval build-up and focus on an ultimate victory in a decisive battle.

name: Technological Supremacy
description: Our dockyards and our industry have limited capacity compared to our rivals in Europe and North America, but our designers and engineers are superior in every way to them. One ship of ours will be worth a dozen of their ships.

name: Long Lance Torpedo
description: Torpedoes, while small, are extremely deadly weapons able to sink even the mightiest battleship, as the pathetic Russian navy learnt during the Battle of Tsushima. However, ships are much larger than 30 years ago, and so we should work to enlarge our torpedoes.

name: Carrier Aviation Breakthroughs
description: Without planes our carriers are just metal boxes which can float. We must ensure that our carriers will always be equipped with only the best planes and pilots.

name: Cruiser Mastery
description: Each cruiser can take on many roles in a naval engagement. Finding enemy fleets but also preventing enemy scouts from find ours. Protect our supply routes same as harassing enemy ones. We can also modify them to very specific roles for hunting submarines, protecting our ships from enemy planes or even carrying large torpedo weaponry; the possibilities are nearly endless.

name: Leviathans of the Pacific
description: What sailors of old have often called sea monsters will soon pale before the leviathans which we are going build. May we name the first one after our great God and Emperor: the Okami!

name: Restart Doctrinal Debate
description: Seen already two decades ago, it is foolish to think that the next war will be won by decisive battle. Rather the next war will be won by resources, industry and attrition. We must change our thinking or it will kill us.

name: Hit and Run
description: Maybe we won't be able to outproduce our enemy but that doesn't we can't win. The Pacific and South East Asia are hostile places where logistics are the difference between victory or defeat. By hitting enemy convoys we can weather him slowly down, where even the mightiest industry won't be able compensate for the losses.

name: Open Seas
description: Our industry is exponentially growing to match our western rivals, but like all growing things it needs food to do so. In this case that means natural resources, which are scarce on the Home Islands. If we want to keep our industry running our priority should be protect shipping routes from enemy raiders.

name: Mass Production
description: Our current fleet is not designed up to our new doctrinal changes. It just doesn't have sufficient numbers of smaller vessels required for the new tasks. There is only one option to solve this situation; a massive build-up of unified, simplified and especially modular designs.

name: Korean Dockyards
description: Dockyards on the Home Islands are already running at maximum capacity using all skilled workforce available. Although the Korean dockyards are hardly as good as our Japanese dockyards, we will nevertheless need their hands to protect our homeland.

name: Modular Aircrafts
description: The modular design applied to our ships was a great success, and our engineers are ready to also apply it on our aircrafts.

name: Co-prosperity Naval Development Plan
description: The dockyard capacity of most of our allies is just laughable. While their workers will never match up to the Japanese spirit, we must support their naval capacity build-up as each and every ship will be needed in the next war.

name: 'Prosperity' Ships
description: We are already building our ships by using certain serial build modules, but now our demand for cargo ships is higher than even before. Our bright engineers propose to build whole ships from modules which will be manufactured on a factory line.

name: Naval Engineering Assistance
description: The target of the Naval Engineering Assistance program is simple; allow our allies build something more than mere cargo ships.

name: Unified Production
description: Now that our allies' naval production is up and running, we can use their new capacity to build a fleet big enough to protect the entire sphere.

name: Hakkou Ichiu
description: Japan's correct direction on the world stage has long been debated between military scholars and ideologues alike but all agree, is all the world not better when it is under one roof?

name: Host the Tokyo Conference
description: Pan-Asian thought is genuinely supported by a large segment of the political classes and is a useful tool regardless. By hosting a major conference in Tokyo and inviting diplomats from all over Asia we can encourage cooperation between Asiatics to stand against Western Imperialism.

name: The Osaka Economic Bureau
description: In Osaka, one of our major industrial cities and a historic trade hub, we have decided to set up a commission drawn from all over Asia. Its duties are mainly concerning the economic ties between members of the Greater East-Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere. By putting resources into this, we can promote autarky and economic self-confidence amongst Asians, and extend our influence over them further.

name: Integrate The Greater Asian Economy
description: Economic power is the key to all, and with undisputed mastery over Asia at our disposal we can begin the process we started in Osaka: tying the economies of East Asia closer to us in order to make them subject to our will.

name: A Mission To India
description: [PRF.GetNameDefCap] is ready for recruitment into our folds. They have reason to fear both renewed domination by Europe as well as the syndicalists which sit on their borders. A better option than attempting to subjugate India ourselves is to throw our lot in with a champion, one that we can cultivate as our ally.

name: Isolate Australasia
description: The Co-Prosperity Sphere's grip on trade in the Pacific is strong, and we should showcase this via punitive sanctions on the imperialistic outpost of European colonialism that is '[AST.GetNameDefCap]'.

name: Nanshin-ron
description: For all its strengths, Japan has a key strategic disadvantage in its dependency on foreign oil. In the pursuit of self-reliance and security against ever-encroaching Western imperialism, surely it would be both wise and just to acquire these resources for ourselves, and in so-doing widen our sphere of security?

name: Extend The Pacific Security Zone
description: With America in chaos, we can ill afford to ignore the opportunity presented. Proposals for creating a Pacific Security Zone that would extend our reach and protection to their far-flung Pacific possessions have come forward and are under serious consideration.

name: Pressure Hawaii
description: Now that the American position in the pacific is weakened, we can make our move to annex the unrecognised nation of "Hawaii" and secure an impenetrable cordon around our empire in the Pacific Ocean.

name: Bring the Philippines into the Fold!
description: Now that the Americans are gone, we can send our gunboats to secure the archipelago for the Co-Prosperity Sphere and bring stability to the islands. Of course, the Filipinos might not see it that way.

name: Create the South Seas Territory
description: Every single island in the Pacific not held by us could act as a staging point to invade our Home Islands. The German Empire has no right to any of these islands and so they are ours for the rightful taking. First will formalise our claims to the area with the South Seas Territory. We can then use those claims to bring them into our empire, be that with diplomacy or the might of the Japanese Imperial Navy.

name: Target: East Indies
description: For centuries the islands of the East Indies have toiled for their Dutch colonial rulers, its vast resources lining European pockets. This practice must end. We shall liberate these assets for the Co-Prosperity Sphere, where they rightfully belong!

name: Target: Indochina
description: An independent Indochina does not align with our strategic plans for the region. We must make a move to secure it as soon as possible.

name: Bring Siam into the Fold!
description: We'd held out hopes that the Siamese would prove amenable to an alliance, but seeing as that isn't the case we must exert force to bring them in line.

name: Issue Colonial Ultimatum
description: We must use this opportunity to claim our rightful role as the sole great power in Asia and in the Pacific: we must demand all [GER.GetAdjective] South-East Asian and Pacific possessions, as well as their Chinese concessions. If they don't meet our demands, then it shall be war!

name: Target: India
description: India is a power that lies in the wings, and one with enough manpower to tip the scales should we let them exist outside of our control for too long. We must act to subjugate them, and quickly.

name: Seishin-ron
description: With Russia not a threat across the Amur River and the Americans embroiled in a civil war, the time has come to fulfil our destiny. China is weak, corrupt and divided and must be lead into the modern age under the guidance of Japan. If the Chinese don't agree, then we shall simply have to teach them a harsh lesson about defiance.

name: Mantetsu Projects
description: Mantetsu manages the railways of Manchuria and Korea on our behalf, and is deeply involved with the economy of North-West China as a result. As we expand our influence into the interior and the coast of our Chinese proxy, they are sure to propose increasingly ambitious projects to develop the region.

name: Support Warlord Allies
description: Many of China's warlords are lining up to bow down and receive Japanese power to back them up like the Old Marshal did. We should oblige them and ensure they are well-equipped to be our proxies in China.

name: Divide and Conquer
description: In all things Chinese, 'divide and conquer' should be our philosophy. While many warlords may wish for our support, we should ensure a good balance of forces on all sides by manipulating the odds in favour of any and all factions, to keep China divided and ripe for the taking when the time comes.

name: National Mobilisation Law
description: The war in China promises to be an immense undertaking that will tax us to the limit. We must ensure the people are ready to bear the burden of warfare of this grand scale.

name: Recruit Collaborators
description: Chinese manpower is an unfortunate necessity for victory, and if we are to rally enough forces to take all of China our conquered regions must provide soldiers as well as resources.

name: Burn to Ash Strategy
description: The Burn to Ash Strategy will be as brutal as it will be effective; those that take up arms against us in resistance shall be killed without mercy, professional soldier or otherwise. We shall supplement this with careful use of blockhouses to hinder the path of guerrillas as well as concentrating civilians in fortified areas to hamper recruitment. This combination will be our road to victory in China.

name: Operation Ichi-gou
description: A series of decisive battles has been planned called Operation Ichi-gou, intended to link up our various armies and crush the Chinese once and for all. We are staking a great deal on this, and if we should prove to be unsuccessful, our stability is sure to suffer as the war will seem un-winnable to the public. But we have every faith in our generals to bring victory at last. Forward Japanese soldiers! Tennō Heika Banzai!

name: The Fruits of Loyalty
description: The government of Zhang Zuolin has been our main ally in China for many years, and supporting him in his quest to unify China has been our goal and the reason for this war. It is therefore imperative that we turn over all land we have taken that he claims as a core part of China.

name: Plant Sakura Trees
description: The blood that we have shed in China has been costly and our gains hard-won. We aren't about to let some jumped-up warlord with ideas about his rights or Chinese nationalism take them from us. Our key claims in China will remain under our control and open to settlement by Japanese people, which we shall symbolise by planting cherry trees.

name: Dismantle the Legation Cities
description: The self-righteous westerners who run [LEC.GetNameDef] have seen fit to exclude us from their councils and halls of power. We shall show them the price of their impudence.

name: Proclaim Victory Over Imperialism
description: Finally, victory is in our grasp. Japan is the undisputed master of all East Asia! We have put our rivals into their place and drove out the Europeans from what is rightfully ours. The Home Isles are the humming centre of Asian economy. When the tiger roars the world trembles!
